transcripts.text: We are now having 40-plus thousand new cases a day.  I would not be surprised if we go up to 100,000 a day.

The number of new cases per day is higher now in 45 of the 50 states than when schools shut down in March.  And with infections now spiking in 39 states, hospitals are facing a crisis.  What the CDC has said is that if children meet in groups, it can put everyone at risk.

I think we better be careful if we are not cavalier in thinking that children are completely immune to the deleterious effects.  We really better be very careful, particularly when it comes to the children.  To be very clear, we don't want CDC guidance to be a reason why people don't reopen their schools.  We have to open our schools.  Open our schools.  Stop this nonsense.

You are compelling schools to reopen regardless of what's happening.  Now what we're saying is that kids need to be back in school.  Yes or no?  Can you assure students, teachers, parents that they will not get coronavirus because they're going back to school?  Well, the key is that kids have to get back to school.
